com.amazonaws.services.polly.model

Class SynthesizeSpeechRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.AmazonWebServiceRequest
      • com.amazonaws.services.polly.model.SynthesizeSpeechRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SynthesizeSpeechRequest
extends AmazonWebServiceRequest
implements java.io.Serializable

    Synthesizes UTF-8 input, plain text or SSML, to a stream of bytes. SSML input must be valid, well-formed SSML. Some alphabets might not be available with all the voices (for example, Cyrillic might not be read at all by English voices) unless phoneme mapping is used. For more information, see How it Works.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getLexiconNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLexiconNames()

        List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, see PutLexicon.

        Returns:

        List of one or more pronunciation lexicon names you want the service to apply during synthesis. Lexicons are applied only if the language of the lexicon is the same as the language of the voice. For information about storing lexicons, see PutLexicon.

      • getOutputFormat

        public java.lang.String getOutputFormat()

        The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

        Constraints:
        Allowed Values: json, mp3, ogg_vorbis, pcm

        Returns:

        The format in which the returned output will be encoded. For audio stream, this will be mp3, ogg_vorbis, or pcm. For speech marks, this will be json.

        See Also:
        OutputFormat

      • getSampleRate

        public java.lang.String getSampleRate()

        The audio frequency specified in Hz.

        The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".

        Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

        Returns:

        The audio frequency specified in Hz.

        The valid values for mp3 and ogg_vorbis are "8000", "16000", and "22050". The default value is "22050".

        Valid values for pcm are "8000" and "16000" The default value is "16000".

        public java.lang.String getTextType()

      • getVoiceId

        public java.lang.String getVoiceId()

        Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the DescribeVoices operation.

        Constraints:
        Allowed Values: Geraint, Gwyneth, Mads, Naja, Hans, Marlene, Nicole, Russell, Amy, Brian, Emma, Raveena, Ivy, Joanna, Joey, Justin, Kendra, Kimberly, Matthew, Salli, Conchita, Enrique, Miguel, Penelope, Chantal, Celine, Mathieu, Dora, Karl, Carla, Giorgio, Mizuki, Liv, Lotte, Ruben, Ewa, Jacek, Jan, Maja, Ricardo, Vitoria, Cristiano, Ines, Carmen, Maxim, Tatyana, Astrid, Filiz, Vicki, Takumi, Seoyeon, Aditi, Lea

        Returns:

        Voice ID to use for the synthesis. You can get a list of available voice IDs by calling the DescribeVoices operation.
